instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD? PP2V5_NAND_SSD is a power rail that powers the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on Macbooks with soldered on storage and must be present for the SSD to show up. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
after removing <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> the short disappeared. My question is: can these nands be replaced? In case they can be replaced, what should be done after welding the new nands?
thanks to all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
You may need to change all SSD chips.
Just in case, replace the both bad chips and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Thanks. I'll do that. Can I put more capacity nands? I mean, expand the memory

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you get the board working in original configuration already???
I don't understand how you think to improve a dead board SSD; probably not repairable even...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: WHAT TO SAY, IN THE ALLEGED CASE THAT IT WORKS.  ALSO TRY TO RESTORE THE MAC WITH THE TWO MEMORIES REPLACED AND I GOT THIS ERROR.  NOTE: THE MAC LOOKS GOOD.  CHARGE WELL, IT HAS GOOD CONSUMPTION BUT GIVES THIS ERROR

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Short <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Please, don't use capital letters for entire message!!!
Don't realize that is more difficult to read the words with same height???

The error is probably SSD related.
